text: Be kind whenever possible. It is always possible.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Believe in yourself! Have faith in your abilities! Without a humble but reasonable confidence in your own powers you cannot be successful or happy.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

text: A creative man is motivated by the desire to achieve, not by the desire to beat others.
author: Ayn Rand

text: If you don't design your own life plan, chances are you'll fall into someone else's plan. And guess what they have planned for you? Not much.
author: Jim Rohn

text: If you're going through hell, keep going.
author: Winston Churchill

text: After a storm comes a calm.
author: Matthew Henry

text: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
author: C. S. Lewis

text: With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: The will to win, the desire to succeed, the urge to reach your full potential... these are the keys that will unlock the door to personal excellence.
author: Confucius

text: Our greatest weakness lies in giving up. The most certain way to succeed is always to try just one more time.
author: Thomas A. Edison

text: Be miserable. Or motivate yourself. Whatever has to be done, it's always your choice.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: Always do your best. What you plant now, you will harvest later.
author: Og Mandino

text: I don't believe you have to be better than everybody else. I believe you have to be better than you ever thought you could be.
author: Ken Venturi

text: Always continue the climb. It is possible for you to do whatever you choose, if you first get to know who you are and are willing to work with a power that is greater than ourselves to do it.
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

text: Expect problems and eat them for breakfast.
author: Alfred A. Montapert

text: Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement. Nothing can be done without hope and confidence.
author: Helen Keller

text: Learn from the past, set vivid, detailed goals for the future, and live in the only moment of time over which you have any control: now.
author: Denis Waitley

text: If you can dream it, you can do it.
author: Walt Disney

text: Do you want to know who you are? Don't ask. Act! Action will delineate and define you.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: Even if you fall on your face, you're still moving forward.
author: Victor Kiam

text: The key is to keep company only with people who uplift you, whose presence calls forth your best.
author: Epictetus

text: By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: You have to learn the rules of the game. And then you have to play better than anyone else.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Either you run the day or the day runs you.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
author: William James

text: I know where I'm going and I know the truth, and I don't have to be what you want me to be. I'm free to be what I want.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: Be Impeccable With Your Word. Speak with integrity. Say only what you mean. Avoid using the word to speak against yourself or to gossip about others. Use the power of your word in the direction of truth and love.
author: Miguel Angel Ruiz

text: Determine never to be idle. No person will have occasion to complain of the want of time who never loses any. It is wonderful how much may be done if we are always doing.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: Things do not happen. Things are made to happen.
author: John F. Kennedy

text: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Learning is the beginning of wealth. Learning is the beginning of health. Learning is the beginning of spirituality. Searching and learning is where the miracle process all begins.
author: Jim Rohn

text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
author: Mark Twain

text: Well done is better than well said.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: If you want to succeed you should strike out on new paths, rather than travel the worn paths of accepted success.
author: John D. Rockefeller

text: We are taught you must blame your father, your sisters, your brothers, the school, the teachers - but never blame yourself. It's never your fault. But it's always your fault, because if you wanted to change you're the one who has got to change.
author: Katharine Hepburn

text: Follow your dreams, work hard, practice and persevere. Make sure you eat a variety of foods, get plenty of exercise and maintain a healthy lifestyle.
author: Sasha Cohen

text: Always desire to learn something useful.
author: Sophocles

text: If you want to conquer fear, don't sit home and think about it. Go out and get busy.
author: Dale Carnegie

text: The more man meditates upon good thoughts, the better will be his world and the world at large.
author: Confucius

text: Quality is not an act, it is a habit.
author: Aristotle

text: Be gentle to all and stern with yourself.
author: Saint Teresa of Avila

text: Set your sights high, the higher the better. Expect the most wonderful things to happen, not in the future but right now. Realize that nothing is too good. Allow absolutely nothing to hamper you or hold you up in any way.
author: Eileen Caddy

text: If you ask me what I came into this life to do, I will tell you: I came to live out loud.
author: Emile Zola

text: I've worked too hard and too long to let anything stand in the way of my goals. I will not let my teammates down and I will not let myself down.
author: Mia Hamm

text: Opportunity does not knock, it presents itself when you beat down the door.
author: Kyle Chandler

text: Problems are not stop signs, they are guidelines.
author: Robert H. Schuller

text: In order to succeed, we must first believe that we can.
author: Nikos Kazantzakis

text: True happiness involves the full use of one's power and talents.
author: John W. Gardner

text: The harder the conflict, the more glorious the triumph.
author: Thomas Paine

text: If you don't like how things are, change it! You're not a tree.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Your talent is God's gift to you. What you do with it is your gift back to God.
author: Leo Buscaglia

text: I'd rather attempt to do something great and fail than to attempt to do nothing and succeed.
author: Robert H. Schuller

text: What you do today can improve all your tomorrows.
author: Ralph Marston

text: Never complain and never explain.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

text: Setting goals is the first step in turning the invisible into the visible.
author: Tony Robbins

text: It's always too early to quit.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

text: The first step toward success is taken when you refuse to be a captive of the environment in which you first find yourself.
author: Mark Caine

text: You can't build a reputation on what you are going to do.
author: Henry Ford

text: Who seeks shall find.
author: Sophocles

text: Do your work with your whole heart, and you will succeed - there's so little competition.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: Set your goals high, and don't stop till you get there.
author: Bo Jackson

text: Know or listen to those who know.
author: Baltasar Gracian

text: What is called genius is the abundance of life and health.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: The hardships that I encountered in the past will help me succeed in the future.
author: Philip Emeagwali

text: When you fail you learn from the mistakes you made and it motivates you to work even harder.
author: Natalie Gulbis

text: Leap, and the net will appear.
author: John Burroughs

text: The most effective way to do it, is to do it.
author: Amelia Earhart

text: Infuse your life with action. Don't wait for it to happen. Make it happen. Make your own future. Make your own hope. Make your own love. And whatever your beliefs, honor your creator, not by passively waiting for grace to come down from upon high, but by doing what you can to make grace happen... yourself, right now, right down here on Earth.
author: Bradley Whitford

text: Begin to be now what you will be hereafter.
author: William James

text: To know oneself, one should assert oneself.
author: Albert Camus

text: You need to overcome the tug of people against you as you reach for high goals.
author: George S. Patton

text: Crave for a thing, you will get it. Renounce the craving, the object will follow you by itself.
author: Swami Sivananda

text: You can never quit. Winners never quit, and quitters never win.
author: Ted Turner

text: In motivating people, you've got to engage their minds and their hearts. I motivate people, I hope, by example - and perhaps by excitement, by having productive ideas to make others feel involved.
author: Rupert Murdoch

text: Go for it now. The future is promised to no one.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: Perseverance is not a long race it is many short races one after the other.
author: Walter Elliot

text: Motivation is the art of getting people to do what you want them to do because they want to do it.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

text: Fear cannot be without hope nor hope without fear.
author: Baruch Spinoza

text: Perseverance is failing 19 times and succeeding the 20th.
author: Julie Andrews

text: Go big or go home. Because it's true. What do you have to lose?
author: Eliza Dushku

text: I can, therefore I am.
author: Simone Weil

text: You can't wait for inspiration. You have to go after it with a club.
author: Jack London

text: Only the educated are free.
author: Epictetus

text: You are not here merely to make a living. You are here in order to enable the world to live more amply, with greater vision, with a finer spirit of hope and achievement. You are here to enrich the world, and you impoverish yourself if you forget the errand.
author: Woodrow Wilson

text: Small deeds done are better than great deeds planned.
author: Peter Marshall

text: Wherever you are - be all there.
author: Jim Elliot

text: No matter how many goals you have achieved, you must set your sights on a higher one.
author: Jessica Savitch

text: To be wholly devoted to some intellectual exercise is to have succeeded in life.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

text: To be a good loser is to learn how to win.
author: Carl Sandburg

text: Without hard work, nothing grows but weeds.
author: Gordon B. Hinckley

text: I learned that we can do anything, but we can't do everything... at least not at the same time. So think of your priorities not in terms of what activities you do, but when you do them. Timing is everything.
author: Dan Millman

text: The wise does at once what the fool does at last.
author: Baltasar Gracian

text: We make the world we live in and shape our own environment.
author: Orison Swett Marden

text: I've found that luck is quite predictable. If you want more luck, take more chances. Be more active. Show up more often.
author: Brian Tracy

text: Be thine own palace, or the world's thy jail.
author: John Donne

text: You can't expect to hit the jackpot if you don't put a few nickels in the machine.
author: Flip Wilson

text: The will to succeed is important, but what's more important is the will to prepare.
author: Bobby Knight

text: I really believe that everyone has a talent, ability, or skill that he can mine to support himself and to succeed in life.
author: Dean Koontz

text: If you've got a talent, protect it.
author: Jim Carrey

text: The weeds keep multiplying in our garden, which is our mind ruled by fear. Rip them out and call them by name.
author: Sylvia Browne

text: Poverty was the greatest motivating factor in my life.
author: Jimmy Dean

text: I was motivated to be different in part because I was different.
author: Donna Brazile

text: One way to keep momentum going is to have constantly greater goals.
author: Michael Korda

text: The ultimate aim of the ego is not to see something, but to be something.
author: Muhammad Iqbal

text: The dog that trots about finds a bone.
author: Golda Meir

text: If you think you can do it, you can.
author: John Burroughs

text: One may miss the mark by aiming too high as too low.
author: Thomas Fuller

text: Do not weep do not wax indignant. Understand.
author: Baruch Spinoza

text: There is nothing deep down inside us except what we have put there ourselves.
author: Richard Rorty

text: You never know what motivates you.
author: Cicely Tyson

text: Big shots are only little shots who keep shooting.
author: Christopher Morley
